title: Makes various changes regarding registration of pesticide products
summary: Provides that an applicant for registration of a pesticide with the department of environmental conservation shall include efficacy data of such pesticide to support each use specified on the labeling; also requires applicant to submit complete copies of all studies performed on the pesticide for purposes of federal registration.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Environmental Conservation

       AN ACT to amend the  environmental  conservation  law,  in  relation  to
         registration of pesticide products

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  Subdivisions 4 and 5 of section 33-0703  of  the  environ-
    2  mental  conservation  law, subdivision 4 as amended and subdivision 5 as
    3  added by chapter 732 of the laws of 2005,  are  amended  and  three  new
    4  subdivisions 6, 7 and 8 are added to read as follows:
    5    4.  [If  requested  by  the  commissioner a] A full description of the
    6  tests made and their results upon which the claims are based,  INCLUDING
    7  EFFICACY  DATA  TO  SUPPORT  EACH USE SPECIFIED ON THE LABELING.  In the
    8  case of registration of a pesticide which has been  registered  for  the
    9  previous year, a statement shall be required only with respect to infor-
   10  mation  which  is  different  from that furnished when the pesticide was
   11  last registered; [and]
   12    5. For restricted use pesticides, if requested by the  commissioner  a
   13  Spanish  or other language translation of the label including directions
   14  for use[.];
   15    6. COMPLETE COPIES OF ALL  STUDIES  PERFORMED  ON  THE  PESTICIDE  FOR
   16  PURPOSES  OF  FEDERAL  REGISTRATION, AS WELL AS ADDITIONAL STUDIES WHICH
   17  MAY BE REQUIRED FOR STATE REGISTRATION;
   18    7. COPIES OF ALL REVIEW DOCUMENTS AND OTHER DOCUMENTS PREPARED BY  THE
   19  UNITED  STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY RELATING TO THE REGISTRA-
   20  TION OF EACH PESTICIDE; AND
   21    8. THE COMPLETE LABORATORY ANALYTICAL METHOD OR METHODS FOR  IDENTIFY-
   22  ING  THE  ACTIVE  INGREDIENT  OR  INGREDIENTS  IN EACH PESTICIDE PRODUCT
   23  PROPOSED FOR REGISTRATION, WHICH SHALL BE  VERIFIED  BY  THE  DEPARTMENT
   24  PRIOR TO REGISTRATION OF THE PESTICIDE PRODUCT.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05274-01-1

       A. 4141                             2

    1    S  2.  Subdivision 6 of section 33-0704 of the environmental conserva-
    2  tion law, as added by chapter 67 of the laws of 1992, is amended to read
    3  as follows:
    4    6.    ALL  STATE  AGENCY  STAFF  EVALUATIONS OF PESTICIDE REGISTRATION
    5  APPLICATIONS SHALL BE PREPARED IN WRITING AND SUBMITTED TO  THE  DEPART-
    6  MENT. THESE DOCUMENTS SHALL BE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC REVIEW UPON REQUEST.
    7  At  any time during the review of an application to register a pesticide
    8  the commissioner may request reasonable additional information from  the
    9  applicant  with  regard  to any matter contained in the application when
   10  such additional information is necessary for the commissioner to make  a
   11  decision on the registration application.  Such request shall not extend
   12  any time period within which a registration decision must be made.
   13    S  3. Section 33-0707 of the environmental conservation law is amended
   14  to read as follows:
   15  S 33-0707.  Disclosure of pesticide formulas.
   16    The commissioner[, whenever he deems  it  necessary  in  the  adminis-
   17  tration  of  subdivisions  1  through 5 inclusive of section 33-0303 and
   18  titles 5, 7, 11, 13 and 15 of  this  article,  may]  SHALL  require  the
   19  submission  of  the  complete formula of any pesticide.  Notwithstanding
   20  the provisions of this article,  information  relative  to  formulas  of
   21  products  acquired  by  authority  of this section may be revealed, when
   22  necessary under this section, to an advisory committee, or to any feder-
   23  al or state department or agency [consulted], OR TO ANY RESEARCH FACILI-
   24  TY WHICH REQUESTS THIS INFORMATION, OR TO ANY PHYSICIAN OR HEALTH FACIL-
   25  ITY REQUESTING THIS INFORMATION, or at a public hearing, or in  findings
   26  of fact issued by the commissioner.
   27    S  4. Section 33-0709 of the environmental conservation law is amended
   28  to read as follows:
   29  S 33-0709.  Requirements for registration.
   30    If [it appears to] the commissioner FINDS that:
   31    1. the composition of the pesticide is such as to warrant the proposed
   32  claims for it, [and if]
   33    2. the pesticide and its labeling and other material  required  to  be
   34  submitted comply with the requirements of this article, [he]
   35    3.  THE PESTICIDE, INCLUDING ITS INERT INGREDIENTS, HAS NOT BEEN CLAS-
   36  SIFIED BY THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY AS  A  KNOWN
   37  HUMAN CARCINOGEN, OR A PROBABLE OR LIKELY CARCINOGEN, OR BY THE INTERNA-
   38  TIONAL AGENCY FOR RESEARCH ON CANCER OF THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION AS
   39  CARCINOGENIC  TO  HUMANS,  PROBABLY  CARCINOGENIC  TO HUMANS OR POSSIBLY
   40  CARCINOGENIC TO HUMANS, AND
   41    4. THE PESTICIDE HAS NOT BEEN TESTED ON HUMANS IN THE UNITED STATES OR
   42  ANY OTHER COUNTRY IN THE WORLD,  THE  COMMISSIONER  shall  register  the
   43  pesticide.
   44    S  5.  The  environmental  conservation law is amended by adding a new
   45  section 33-0710 to read as follows:
   46  S 33-0710. PRIORITIZATION OF REVIEWS OF CURRENTLY REGISTERED PESTICIDES.
   47    EVERY PESTICIDE REGISTERED BY THE DEPARTMENT PRIOR  TO  THE  EFFECTIVE
   48  DATE  OF THIS SECTION, WHICH HAS NOT BEEN SUBJECT TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF
   49  SECTION 33-0709 OF THIS TITLE SHALL BE REVIEWED BY THE DEPARTMENT. THESE
   50  PESTICIDES SHALL BE PRIORITIZED FOR REVIEW,  BASED  ON  THEIR  TOXICITY,
   51  THEIR  POTENTIAL  FOR  HUMAN  EXPOSURE AND THEIR POTENTIAL TO DAMAGE THE
   52  ENVIRONMENT AND NATURAL RESOURCES.  THE  DEPARTMENT  SHALL  ESTABLISH  A
   53  SCHEDULE TO CONDUCT REVIEWS OF THESE PESTICIDES, SHALL ESTABLISH A SCHE-
   54  DULE  TO  REQUIRE  FULL DATA CURRENTLY REQUIRED FOR FEDERAL REGISTRATION
   55  AND TO MAKE REGISTRATION DECISIONS ON THESE PRODUCTS.

       A. 4141                             3

    1    S 6. Section 33-0711 of the environmental conservation law is  amended
    2  to read as follows:
    3  S 33-0711. Procedure when registration is denied.
    4    1.  If  the  commissioner  shall  decide  that  the pesticide does not
    5  warrant the proposed claims for it or if the pesticide and its  labeling
    6  and  other  material  required  to  be  submitted do not comply with the
    7  provisions of this article, he shall notify the applicant for  registra-
    8  tion  of  the manner in which the pesticide, labeling, or other material
    9  required to be submitted fail to comply  with  this  article  so  as  to
   10  afford  the registrant an opportunity to make the necessary corrections.
   11  If, upon receipt of such notice, the applicant for registration does not
   12  make the corrections, the commissioner  shall  refuse  to  register  the
   13  article,  and  shall  notify the applicant of his action and the reasons
   14  for his refusal. Whenever an application for  registration  is  refused,
   15  the  applicant,  within  thirty  days  after  service  of notice of such
   16  refusal, may file a petition requesting that the matter be  referred  to
   17  an advisory committee or file objections and request a public hearing in
   18  accordance with section 33-0717 OF THIS TITLE.
   19    2.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL NOT REGISTER ANY PESTICIDE WHICH HAS BEEN
   20  CONDITIONALLY REGISTERED BY THE UNITED STATES  ENVIRONMENTAL  PROTECTION
   21  AGENCY.   THE REGISTRANT OF ANY PESTICIDE REGISTERED PRIOR TO THE EFFEC-
   22  TIVE DATE OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL HAVE A PERIOD OF FIVE YEARS FROM THE
   23  EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS SUBDIVISION TO  SUBMIT  ALL  OUTSTANDING  FEDERAL
   24  DATA  REQUIREMENTS  AND  STUDIES,  AND  ALL  UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL
   25  PROTECTION AGENCY REVIEW DOCUMENTS OR OTHER DOCUMENTS RELATING TO  THESE
   26  DATA  REQUIREMENTS AND STUDIES, TO THE DEPARTMENT. FAILURE TO SUBMIT THE
   27  REQUIRED DATA AND DOCUMENTS SHALL RESULT IN CANCELLATION OF  THE  PESTI-
   28  CIDE BY THE DEPARTMENT. SECTION 33-0715 OF THIS TITLE SHALL NOT APPLY TO
   29  THIS SUBDIVISION.
   30    3. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL NOT REGISTER ANY PESTICIDE WHICH CONTAINS AN
   31  INERT INGREDIENT WHICH WAS SUBJECT TO A PESTICIDE REGISTRATION CANCELLA-
   32  TION  OR SUSPENSION BY THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY
   33  OR THIS STATE.
   34    S 7. Section 33-0713 of the environmental conservation law is  amended
   35  by adding a new subdivision 4 to read as follows:
   36    4.  NOTWITHSTANDING  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  SUBDIVISION  THREE  OF  THIS
   37  SECTION, IF A PESTICIDE, INCLUDING ITS INERT INGREDIENTS, IS A KNOWN  OR
   38  PROBABLE  HUMAN  CARCINOGEN  WHICH HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY REGISTERED BY THE
   39  DEPARTMENT, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL NOTIFY THE REGISTRANT OF THE  CANCEL-
   40  LATION, WHICH SHALL TAKE EFFECT THIRTY DAYS AFTER SERVICE OF THE NOTICE.
   41    S  8.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   42  have become a law, provided however that the amendments to subdivision 6
   43  of section 33-0704 of the environmental conservation law made by section
   44  two of this act shall not affect the repeal of such section and shall be
   45  deemed repealed therewith.
